ygData.subject: Re: Not the momma
ygData.msgSnippet: At close range Slayers shot missed Lunarpine. He twisted and turned making himself as hard a target as possible. He held tightly to slayer trying to force him

From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

At close range Slayers shot missed Lunarpine. He twisted and turned making
himself as hard a target as possible. He held tightly to slayer trying to
force him down. Slayers strength couldn't match Lunarpines rage as the two
started to descend toward the ground. Lunarpine heard a change in Slayers
backpack and noticed the ground getting closer. He released the claws on his
left arm and slashed at Slayers back. he'd already started gamaging the
flight device he might as well finish the job. "I'm taking you down
Striker." he yells to slayer hoping his old name might rattle him a little.
----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, October 23, 2000 9:32 AM
Subject: Re: Not the momma


> I'm waiting for Minime to reply to Mangus and everyone before I reply
> with Ramulus and co. He has lots of chars in this conflict, so I
> don't
> think it'd be fair to continue without him.
>
> ::Slayer::
>
> Slayer growls as Lunarpine insults him, firing again at the enemy
> wolf. Lunarpine's punch severs one of the connections to Slayer's
> jetpack, the device losing power. Not enough strength to keep two
> bots
> in the air, the jetpack burns at its maximum, but the two bots begin
> decending.
>
> Slayer takes hold of Lunarpine's arm, attempting to dislodge the bot.
> Somehow, this Maximal seemed familiar to him, like he had met him
> before, perhaps in a past life. Shaking those thoughts aside, Slayer
> continues to try to dislodge Lunarpine.
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lunarpine takes the shots in the wolfs stomach. the piecing causing
> mech
> > fluid to begin to leak. He transformed to robot wrapping one arm
> around
> > Slayers neck he punches him in the back of the head trying to alter
> the
> > course of flight and force him to the ground. "Land ya slagging
> Omega" (The
> > Omega is the lowest wolf in the pack)  he punched again using his
> new
> > strength to take the former maximal to where the real fight can
> begin.
> >
> > Magnus called for an end to the fighting but under the
> circumstances
> he
> > couldn't stop. If he stopped he'd have to let go, and if he let go
> the fall
> > would be a doosy. He was still learning about his new abilities and
> didn't
> > want to find out how well he could take a fal
>
>
>
>
>
